title: Giovanni van Bronckhorst earmarked as future manager of Manchester City's sister club New York City
text:
Giovanni van Bronckhorst is being earmarked as a future manager of New York City, sister club of Manchester City.

The former Holland international has been spending time immersing himself in City Football Group's global operation after leaving Feyenoord in the summer.

City chiefs are talking about Van Bronckhorst as a potential boss at their American club.

Giovanni van Bronckhorst has been earmarked as a future manager of New York City

New York recently won the MLS Eastern Conference under Pep Guardiola's former assistant, Domenec Torrent.

Torrent, who guided New York into the MLS playoffs later this month, signed a contract until 2020.

The 57-year-old is likely to attract interest from Europe after guiding New York to their best-ever season.

Van Bronckhorst has been immersing himself in City Football Group's global operation

Van Bronckhorst has admirers at City and his new role, a behind-the-scenes look at the football and business side of the club's vast operation, is similar to Patrick Vieira's after his retirement in 2011.

Vieira went on to coach the club's Elite Development Squad before then taking the reins at New York. Torrent replaced him last year when Vieira was appointed Nice manager.
